hero.title: Multi-CLI Environment Switcher
hero.tagline-1: enter a zen-like flow state for programming.
hero.subtitle: Unified management for Claude Code, Codex, and OpenCode configurations with API proxy auto-failover

features.title: Features

multiCli.title: Multi-CLI Support
multiCli.desc: Support for Claude Code, Codex, and OpenCode with per-project configuration

multiConfig.title: Config Management
multiConfig.desc: Manage all API provider configs in a unified JSON file

daemon.title: Unified Daemon
daemon.desc: Single zend process hosts both the proxy server and the Web UI

failover.title: Proxy Failover
failover.desc: Built-in HTTP proxy with automatic failover when primary provider is unavailable

routing.title: Scenario Routing
routing.desc: Intelligent routing based on request characteristics (thinking, image, etc.)

binding.title: Project Bindings
binding.desc: Bind directories to specific profiles and CLIs for automatic project-level configuration

envVars.title: Environment Variables
envVars.desc: Configure per-CLI environment variables at the provider level

tui.title: CLI Config
tui.desc: Manage providers, profiles, and settings directly via CLI subcommands

webUi.title: Web Interface
webUi.desc: Browser-based visual management with password-protected access

webSecurity.title: Web Security
webSecurity.desc: Auto-generated password, session-based auth, RSA encryption for token transport

configSync.title: Config Sync
configSync.desc: Sync providers, profiles, and settings across devices with AES-256-GCM encryption

features.comingSoon: More features coming soon, stay tuned!

items.start: Start CLI (uses project binding or default config)
items.configResetPassword: Reset the Web UI access password
items.configSync: Pull config from remote sync backend
items.bindCli: Bind current directory to specified CLI
items.web: Open Web UI in browser (auto-starts daemon)

index.title: GoZen Documentation
index.subtitle: Learn how to install, configure, and use GoZen to manage your AI coding assistants.

providers.title: Provider Management
providers.intro: A provider represents an API endpoint configuration including base URL, auth token, model name, and more.
providers.envVarsDesc: Each provider can have per-CLI environment variables:

profiles.title: Profiles & Failover
profiles.intro: A profile is an ordered list of providers for failover. When the first provider is unavailable, it automatically switches to the next one.

routing.title: Scenario Routing
routing.intro: Automatically route requests to different providers based on request characteristics.
routing.fallbackDesc: If all providers for a scenario fail, it automatically falls back to the profile's default providers.

bindings.title: Project Bindings
bindings.intro: Bind directories to specific profiles and/or CLIs for automatic project-level configuration.
bindings.priorityDesc: CLI arguments > Project bindings > Global defaults

multiCli.title: Multi-CLI Support
multiCli.intro: GoZen supports three AI coding assistant CLIs:

webUi.title: Web Interface
webUi.intro: Visually manage all configurations through your browser. The daemon starts automatically when needed.

features.settings: Global settings (default client, default Profile, ports)

webUi.securityDesc: When the daemon starts for the first time, it auto-generates an access password. Non-local requests (outside 127.0.0.1/::1) require login.

security.rsaEncryption: RSA encryption for sensitive token transport (API keys encrypted in-browser)

configSync.title: Config Sync
configSync.intro: Sync providers, profiles, default profile, and default client across devices. Auth tokens are encrypted with AES-256-GCM (PBKDF2-SHA256 key derivation) before upload.

backends.s3: AWS S3 or S3-compatible storage (e.g. MinIO, Cloudflare R2)
backends.gist: Private gist (requires PAT with gist scope)
backends.repo: Repository file via Contents API (requires PAT with repo scope)

configSync.setupWebUi: Configure sync through the Web UI settings page:
configSync.encryptionDesc: When a passphrase is set, all auth tokens in the sync payload are encrypted with AES-256-GCM using a key derived via PBKDF2-SHA256 (600k iterations). The encryption salt is stored alongside the payload. Without a passphrase, data is uploaded as plaintext JSON.

conflicts.timestamp: Per-entity timestamp merge: newer modification wins
conflicts.tombstone: Deleted entities use tombstones (expire after 30 days)
